com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.tuples

Interface IReadOnlyTupleStorage

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IReadOnlyDataStorage<ITupleSetDescriptor,ITupleSet>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IRWLockedTupleStorage, ITupleStorage
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JDBCTupleStorage, MemoryTupleStorage, RWLockedTupleStorageProxy

    public interface IReadOnlyTupleStorage
extends IReadOnlyDataStorage<ITupleSetDescriptor,ITupleSet>
    A read-only interface to tuple storage using an SQL-based language.
    1. Application name maps to a database (so implementation can host multiple application databases). Each application has a single database.
    2. ITupleSets are mapped to tables. There can be multiple tables per database.
    3. ITuples are mapped to rows in the associated ITupleSet's table.
    4. ITupleEntrys are mapped to columns in the row of the associated ITuple.
    The storage must be connected to using the IReadOnlyDataStorage.connect(IApplicationDescriptor) method prior to doing any reads of the storage. Storage may host data for multiple applications, so an IApplicationDescriptor is required when connecting.
    Author:
    dawood

      • query

        ITupleSet query(IApplicationDescriptor applicationDescriptor,
              java.lang.String tableName,
              java.lang.String sql)
                throws DSMException
        Execute the given sql against the given app and place the results in a tuple set with the name of an existing table within the app.
        Parameters:
        appDesc -
        tableName - this names an existing table within the app that could be used to store the results of the query. As such it is also the name assigned to the resulting tuple set.
        sql - query statement that generates results in the same schema as the identifier table.
        Returns:
        null if the named table does not exist, otherwise a tuple set with a tuple descriptor for the named table. The tuple set then contains the results of the sql query.
        Throws:
        DSMException - if the sql did not generate a schema that matches the named table.

      • queryAll

        ITupleSet queryAll(IApplicationDescriptor applicationDescriptor,
                 java.lang.String tableName)
                   throws DSMException
        Get all tuples from the given table in the given application.
        Parameters:
        appDesc -
        tableName -
        Returns:
        null if the named table does not exist, otherwise the contents of the table.
        Throws:
        DSMException
